text: My mission:
Get as many Kingsman The Secret Service interviews as I can...
on a very crowded red carpet!
The action sequences in this movie are spectacular.
Were they complicated to shoot?
They were!
I mean they were shot - different sequences were shot in different styles and different ways.
The BIG sequence...THE sequence...
That was a continuous single camera sequence.
So it was unusual to shoot that way
whether it's a fight or not.
I mean, films are made with intercutting and - y'know
cutaways and a close-up on a hand, and the other guy looking back
that didn't have any of that.
It was like a piece of live theater.
And the camera operator had a, you know, a handheld...
he had to be part of the choreography.
So we all, you know, I had to train so I could do the moves
and then I had to remember them.
Because if you're on your left foot instead of your right
there's a collision!
But it was exhilarating!
Just from the point of view of teamwork.
And being fitter than I was when I was twenty!
With the film, who's your favorite character?
Who do you think transitioned the best to the big screen?
Ah well, that's so difficult to - !
I mean they ALL are just the characters I would love them to be.
I mean, I think - there are some great actors in this.
I mean, you couldn't even list them!
But I think Taron Egerton who plays young Eggsy
a virtual unknown
he holds his own so well amongst these superstars
and he makes it really believable that he could come from the streets
and end up being this really suave secret agent
so I really, really enjoyed his part in it.
